entry.title: RT pedrouid.eth 📲: Had a great time chatting with @sinahab about wallets, account abstraction and as always WalletConnect 📲
entry.summary: RT pedrouid.eth 📲 Had a great time chatting with @sinahab about wallets, account abstraction and as always WalletConnect 📲 Sina Habibian: Here’s my conversation with @pedrouid at @WalletConnect We talked about WalletConnect v2 and its architecture, account abstraction, potential downstream effects of a crypto-native chat protocol, and other topics. Hope you enjoy 🙏

entry.title: RT Orbis, the web3 social protocol: Social media content shouldn’t be immutable, even in web3. Users need to be able to edit or request the deletion ...
entry.summary: RT Orbis, the web3 social protocol Social media content shouldn’t be immutable, even in web3. Users need to be able to edit or request the deletion of their own content whenever they want. This is why we recently introduced the edit and delete functions for posts, here is how it works 👇

entry.summary: RT kristiehuang.eth quick thread to share some dev experience improvements on the Uniswap swap widget tldr you can now get all of Uniswap Protocol’s functionality on your site in one line of code Uniswap Labs 🦄: 🚨🚨🚨 Add Uniswap to your app with one line of code — no need to worry about a web3 provider or JSON-RPC endpoint to get started. Shout out to our intern @kristiehuang for this Widget update! Try it out: https://docs.uniswap.org/sdk/widgets/swap-widget
